text: Sovereign Turkic States, with limitedly recognized Northern Cyprus. This article is a comparison of the Turkic states. ==Geography== {|class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align: right;" |- !Country !Area (km²) !Land area (km²) !Water area (km²) |- |style="text-align: left;"|Azerbaijan || 86,600 || 86,100 || 500 |- |style="text-align: left;"|Kazakhstan || 2,724,900 || 2,699,700 || 25,200 |- |style="text-align: left;"|Kyrgyzstan || 199,951 || 191,801 || 8,150 |- |style="text-align: left;"|Turkey || 783,562 || 769,632 || 13,930 |- |style="text-align: left;"|Turkmenistan || 488,100 || 469,930 || 18,170 |- |style="text-align: left;"|Uzbekistan || 447,400 || 425,400 || 22,000 |- |} ==Politics== ===Government=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !Country !Political systems !Power source !Power structure |- |style="text-align: left;"| Azerbaijan | Semi-presidential system | Constitutional republic |rowspan=6| Unitary state |- |style="text-align: left;"| Kazakhstan | Presidential system | Constitutional republic |- |style="text-align: left;"| Kyrgyzstan | Parliamentary System | Constitutional republic |- |style="text- align: left;"| Turkey | Presidential system | Constitutional republic |- |style="text-align: left;"| Turkmenistan | Presidential system | Constitutional republic under a one-party authoritarian state (de facto) |- |style="text-align: left;"| Uzbekistan | Presidential system | Constitutional republic under an authoritarian state (de facto) |} ===International organisation membership=== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !Country !
